Name.BusinessNameLine1: THE LEEPA-RATTNER MUSEUM OF ART INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE LEEPA-RATTNER MUSEUM OF ART COMMITS TO EXCELLENCE IN VISUAL ARTS EDUCATION, FOSTERS AESTHETIC, CRITICAL AND ETHICAL THINKING AS A BRIDGE TO THE FUTURE AND NURTURES INTEREST IN 20TH CENTURY ART HISTORY BY COLLECTING, PRESERVING AND EXHIBITING THE ART OF ABRAHAM RATTNER, ESTHER GENTLE, ALLEN LEEPA AND THEIR CONTEMPORARIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE LEEPA-RATTNER MUSEUM OF ART COMMITS TO EXCELLENCE IN VISUAL ARTS EDUCATION, FOSTERS AESTHETIC, CRITICAL AND ETHICAL THINKING AS A BRIDGE TO THE FUTURE AND NURTURES INTEREST IN 20TH CENTURY ART HISTORY BY COLLECTING, PRESERVING AND EXHIBITING THE ART OF ABRAHAM RATTNER, ESTHER GENTLE, ALLEN LEEPA AND THEIR CONTEMPORARIES.
IRS990.Description: UTILIZE THE MUSEUM TO ENHANCE THE EDUCATION, EDUCATIONAL ENJOYMENT AND AESTHETIC EXPERIENCE OF MEMBERS OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, ITS STUDENTS AND "ALL WHO PASS THROUGH ITS DOORS."

Activity2.Description: THE MUSEUM COLLECTS, PRESERVES AND DISPLAYS WORKS OF ARTISTIC MERIT THAT REFLECT THE INFLUENCES AND CULTURAL CONCERNS OF ABRAHAM RATTNER, ESTHER GENTLE, ALLEN LEEPA AND OTHER RELATED ARTISTS OF THE 20TH CENTURY.

Activity3.Description: THE MUSEUM STORE OFFERS ITEMS FOR SALE THAT REPRESENT ARTISTS OF THE 20TH CENTURY AND THAT SEEK TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ON THE HISTORY OF ART AND EDUCATION.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: COLLECTIONS AND RELATION TO EXEMPT PURPOSE
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART III, LINE 4
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE MUSEUM PROMOTES EDUCATIONAL EXCELLENCE BY COLLECTING, PRESERVING, AND DISPLAYING WORKS OF ART THAT REFLECT OR SUPPORT THE AESTHETIC CONCERNS OF ABRAHAM RATTNER, ESTHER GENTLE, ALLEN LEEPA AND OTHER ARTISTS. THE MUSEUM COMMITS TO EXCELLENCE IN VISUAL ARTS EDUCATION, FOSTERS AESTHETIC, CRITICAL AND ETHICAL THINKING AS A BRIDGE TO THE FUTURE AND NURTURES INTEREST IN 20TH CENTURY ART HISTORY.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 8
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: MUSEUM STORE EXPENSES 1,127 SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 14,902 SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES -14,902 MUSEUM STORE EXPENSES -1,127

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 2D
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: MUSEUM STORE EXPENSES 1,127 SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 14,902

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XIII, LINE 2D
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 14,902 MUSEUM STORE EXPENSES 1,127

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE LEEPA-RATTNER MUSEUM OF ART COMMITS TO EXCELLENCE IN VISUAL ARTS EDUCATION, FOSTERS AESTHETIC, CRITICAL AND ETHICAL THINKING AS A BRIDGE TO THE FUTURE AND NURTURES INTEREST IN 20TH CENTURY ART HISTORY BY COLLECTING, PRESERVING AND EXHIBITING THE ART OF ABRAHAM RATTNER, ESTHER GENTLE, ALLEN LEEPA AND THEIR CONTEMPORARIES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ELECTION OF MEMBERS AND THEIR RIGHTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MUSEUM'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS ELECTS MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BOARD. DECISIONS OF COMMITTEES REQUIRING BOARD APPROVAL WILL BE VOTED ON BY THE FULL BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: DECISIONS SUBJECT TO APPROVAL OF MEMBERS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MUSEUM'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS ELECTS MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BOARD. DECISIONS OF COMMITTEES REQUIRING BOARD APPROVAL WILL BE VOTED ON BY THE FULL BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO THE QUARTERLY BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETING. FINANCE COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW AND REPORT BACK ANY FINDINGS OR COMMENTS TO THE BOARD AND WILL ULTIMATELY RECOMMEND APPROVAL OR REJECTION OF THE FORM 990 TO THE BOARD.

THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS MONITORED BY THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. ANNUALLY, ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS.

THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION OF THE MUSEUM'S TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS VIA REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF INDEPENDENT PERSONS, COMPARABILITY DATA AND CONTEMPORANEOUS SUBSTANTIATION OF DELIBERATION AND DECISION BY ST. PETERSBURG COLLEGE.

THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION OF THE MUSEUM'S TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS VIA REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF INDEPENDENT PERSONS, COMPARABILITY DATA AND CONTEMPORANEOUS SUBSTANTIATION OF DELIBERATION AND DECISION BY ST. PETERSBURG COLLEGE.
THE MUSEUM'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST.

SCHEDULE R, PART V, LINE 2, TRANSACTION TYPE "C": THE ST. PETERSBURG COLLEGE FOUNDATION, INC. IS ALSO RELATED TO THE MUSEUM, AS IT IS A DIRECT SUPPORT ORGANIZATION OF THE COLLEGE. THE ST. PETERSBURG COLLEGE FOUNDATION, INC. HAS PERMANENTLY LOANED THE LEEPA-RATTNER-GENTLE AND CANADIAN DONORS ART COLLECTIONS TO THE COLLEGE FOR 1.00. THE COLLEGE PROVIDED THE INSURANCE FOR THE COLLECTIONS UNTIL 2010. STARTING IN 2010 THE FOUNDATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE INSURANCE ON THE ART COLLECTIONS AT A COST OF APPROXIMATELY 20,000 PER YEAR. THE COLLEGE HAS LOANED THE COLLECTIONS TO THE MUSEUM. SCHEDULE R, PART V, LINE 2, TRANSACTION TYPE "L": THE ST. PETERSBURG COLLEGE FOUNDATION COLLECTED AN INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT FEE FROM AN ENDOWMENT HELD BY THE FOUNDATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE MUSEUM.

FORM 990, PART V, LINE 1B - STATEMENTS REGARDING OTHER IRS FILING AND TAX COMPLIANCE THE ORGANIZATION FILED 7 W-2G'S FOR THEIR "LUCKY DRAW" DRAWINGS AT THEIR GALA EVENT HELD IN MARCH 2009. THE REVENUES AND EXPENSES TO THAT EVENT WERE POSTED TO THE 2008 990EZ, BECAUSE OF THE CLIENT'S FISCAL YEAR ENDING 3/31. NO GAMING EVENTS WERE DONE IN FISCAL YEAR 2009 TO BE REPORTED ON SCHEDULE G. FORM 990, PART V, LINE 2A AND 2B - ACTIVITIES & GOVERNANCE THE ORGANIZATIONS PAYROLL IS REPORTED UNDER A RELATED ORGANIZATION, ST. PETERSBURG COLLEGE (SPC). THE NUMBER OF EMPLOYEES REPORTED REPRESENTS ALL THE ORGANIZATION'S EMPLOYEES. SPC FILED ALL FEDERAL EMPLOYMENT TAX RETURNS.
